content.description: Pick your style for this short climb with fun movement. A boulder move off the ground into a lie-back finger-crack gives way to a ledge to protect your ground fall and roof turn from. Turn the mini-roof for nice holds and a great hand jam.
content.protection: Standard rack, small to med gear. Sling the boulder or gear anchor. Rap from tree or sketchy walk off towards the left into My First Rodeo.
content.location: Obvious crack system just left of Shelf Life.

content.description: Pretty sustained, steep line on an overhanging face just left of the arete. Start by coming out an overhang and move up on good jugs and edges. Take a rest at a ledge below the last bolt and finish it up. Eases as you get higher.
content.protection: Fixed draws/chains on all bolts and anchors.
content.location: Climbers left of F.O.A. and strawberry shortcake; right of Wham, Bam Thank You Ma'am. Perched above a little fourth class scramble.

content.description: very hard start up to hard climbing once you reach the ledge it gets much easier. when first climbed it went at 5.13a new beta i believe makes it much easier. If you want to climb it the 5.13 way then use the horrible arrowhead looking hold near the start.

Short but sweet inverted climb. Start in front of a short boulder, reach up for the start holds get feet up and on and pull up for the first clip, make balanced overhung moves to a side pull, climb up to the bottom of the roof and then you're in it. Fun but powerful moves lead to the top!

Unique roof for the area with quality movement. Easy face to a dramatic roof and a bomber 3-finger pocket just before gaining the ledge. 

  If any 200 pound crushers get on this, a hold or two might change shape. Watch out, belayers.
content.protection:
Four or five bolts on the face, three hanging draws on the roof. 

  The second roof bolt is a spinner. Should still be solid, though it may shortly be replaced with a glue-in. 

  You may notice two oddly place bolts (to the left of first roof bolt and to the right of the prow under the anchors). These were placed by the landowners before knowing how the line would climb.
content.location: Left of Shelf Life and underneath/to-the-right of Ain't My First Rodeo.

content.description: One of the best at Jamestown. Starts with vertical/technical climbing with a reachy crux move right off of the ground. The route continues with a couple more pumpy moves to a rest below the roof. The roof itself is pumpfest on jugs. Pull the lip onto the face and you are at the anchors. Don't grab the root.
content.location: This route is near the midway point of Jamestown crag. It climbs the overhang immediately right of Strawberry Shortcake.
